it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys

Class DatasetRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>
        • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.SymbolTable
          • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.sys.DatasetRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Symbol<?>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatrixModule

    public class DatasetRecord
extends SymbolTable
    A DatasetRecord is a symbol table that represents a row in a dataset. In this case, each symbol represents an attribute of the dataset (a column of a table) A dataset must have a schema, represented by a DatasetSchema This class also provides some utility static methods
    Author:
    edoardovacchi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static DatasetRecord emptyRecord(DatasetRecord r)

      • linkTo

        public static DatasetRecord linkTo(java.util.List<Symbol<?>> columnList)
        creates a new DatasetRecord for the given list of symbols, using these symbols as the data values. It also sets automatically a DatasetSchema conforming to the given symbol types and names
        Parameters:
        columnList -
        Returns:
        the new record instances

      • setSchema

        public void setSchema(DatasetSchema d)
        Set the schema for this instance to be the same as the parameter, by performing a full copy (all symbols are cloned).
        Parameters:

      • setAll

        public void setAll(DatasetRecord r)
        for each value in the argument dataset record, copies the values in the corresponding keys. Keys must exist in the current object
        Parameters:
        r -
        Throws:
        MissingSymbolException - if the schemas are mismatched
